text: Sang Guowei (Chinese: 桑国卫; pinyin: Sāng Guówèi) (11 November 1941 – 7 December 2023) was a Chinese pharmacologist, physician and politician. ==Early life and Career== He was a native of Wuxing, Zhejiang and was born in Shanghai. After finishing his studies at Shanghai Medical College, he became a member of the Chinese Academy of Engineering. He led the Chinese Peasants' and Workers' Democratic Party, a smaller political group in China. From 2008 to 2013, he held the role of Vice Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress. ==Death== On 7 December 2023, Guowei passed away due to an illness (which is not known). He was 82 years old at the time of his death. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2023 deaths Category:20th-century Chinese politicians Category:Chinese physicians Category:21st-century Chinese politicians
title: Sang Guowei
